results.title: Cousins
results.creator_credit: Helen Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Helen Atkinson believes that family should always be close so you have someone to turn to when you need them the most. She shares a close bond with her cousin and wouldn’t have it any other way.

results.title: Life story
results.creator_credit: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Joel Atkinson’s parents split up, his dad took him to Shepparton. Determined to make the most of it, Atkinson worked hard to be a good role model for his siblings.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Mike Kenneally and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion) tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821) and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.
results.title_for_label: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery, Mike Kenneally and ACMI

In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).

The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).

results.title: Why do they call me Rambo?
results.creator_credit: Bindie Jack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nicknamed ‘Rambo’ by his friends and named after his grandfather, a great fighter, Bindie Jack’s dad had hoped that Jack would follow in his pop’s footsteps. Jack has found an interest in fighting, just not exactly as his dad had intended.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bindie Jack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.

results.creator_credit: Laura Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Laura Bell reflects on her life through the things that have made her proud. Bell’s family, her community and her achievements are what keep her driven and passionate about her work.

results.title: Mum and dad
results.creator_credit: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
